title: George of the Jungle
descriptions:
George of the Jungle (1997) is a live-action comedy adventure that follows the hilariously heroic exploits of George, a vine-swinging, well-meaning but clumsy man raised by animals in the African jungle. The story begins when Ursula Stanhope, a wealthy and adventurous San Francisco socialite, travels to the jungle with her snobbish fiancé, Lyle Van de Groot. During an expedition guided by two poachers, Max and Thor, Lyle accidentally causes Ursula to be endangered. George swings in to save her but crashes in his signature fashion, bringing her back to his treetop home to recover.

George lives under the watchful eye of Ape, a highly intelligent, well-spoken gorilla with refined tastes and a dry wit. His best friend is a small, enthusiastic capuchin named Tookie Tookie. As Ursula heals, she and George bond over his gentle nature and childlike charm, and she witnesses him courageously protect his animal family from threats. Lyle returns with a rescue party, but amid chaos and misunderstanding, he accidentally shoots Ape (with a tranquilizer) and gets himself arrested for firing a weapon. Ursula convinces George to come with her to San Francisco so he can experience her world.

In San Francisco, George becomes a fish out of water, marveling at modern life and wreaking slapstick havoc while maintaining his unfailing kindness. He wins over Ursula’s friends and even rescues people, notably performing a daring rescue of a man stranded on the Bay Bridge by swinging on ropes, becoming a local hero. Meanwhile, Ursula struggles with pressure from her controlling mother, who wants her to marry Lyle and abandon her jungle fling. Ursula realizes she’s fallen in love with George, whose sincerity, bravery, and goofy charm stand in stark contrast to Lyle’s selfishness and arrogance.

Back in the jungle, Max and Thor realize Ape can speak and scheme to kidnap him for fame and fortune. They return, capture Ape, and plan to exploit him. George senses his family is in danger and rushes back to Africa, heartbroken but determined. Ursula follows, breaking off her engagement for good after Lyle, now delusional and dressed as a jungle holy man, tries to win her back with absurd theatrics.

In the jungle finale, George confronts the poachers and rescues Ape in a series of slapstick battles that showcase his agility, bravery, and signature vine-swinging. Lyle, pursuing Ursula, blunders deeper into the jungle, mistakenly marries a female gorilla in a farcical ceremony, and is effectively removed from the picture. George then must save Ursula when she is carried toward danger by stampeding animals. Summoning courage and drawing on everything he’s learned, he swings to her rescue in the film’s triumphant climax.

With the villains defeated and Ape safe, George and Ursula marry in a joyous jungle ceremony attended by their animal friends. The sophisticated Ape, freed from captivity, later heads to Las Vegas to capitalize on his talents in a playful epilogue, finally getting the spotlight he always wanted. George and Ursula settle into a happy life among the treetops, eventually welcoming a child and continuing the playful, chaotic, and loving existence that blends human warmth with wild adventure.

The film, narrated with tongue-in-cheek humor that frequently breaks the fourth wall, parodies classic jungle hero tropes while celebrating heart, family, and the idea that true nobility comes from kindness rather than sophistication. George, forever earnest and endearing, remains the king of the jungle in spirit, even if he still occasionally hits that tree.
